translated: The Birth Story of the Horse Kuṇḍaka in the Belly
having eaten the water for washing rice,
why don’t you eat it now?”
“Where they do not know if you are fat
or thin, or your age or training,
even the water for washing rice is plenty.

analyzed: y ādi sāyam ha y uttamaḥ
translated: and what kind of excellent horse I am,
knowing, having come to one who knows,
I will not eat your food, Kuṇḍaka.”
The Birth Story of the Horse Kuṇḍaka in the Belly, the fourth.
